author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: Presented by The Coalition to Strengthen America's Healthcare {beacon} Health Care Health Care   The Big Story  House GOP not synced on Medicaid plans  One of the thorniest issues facing House Republicans has yet to be resolved, even as the Energy and Commerce Committee barrels toward a meeting early next week to mark up its...
title: House GOP out of sync on Medicaid

author: Aris Folley
description: Welcome to The Hill's Business & Economy newsletter {beacon} Business & Economy Business & Economy The Big Story  Trump’s last-ditch push to tax the rich The White House is making a last-ditch push to raise taxes on the wealthiest Americans as part of President Trump’s “big beautiful bill.” © The Associated Press A source said...
title: Trump's push for upper-class tax hike

author: Mychael Schnell
description: A key group of moderate House Republicans says it is rejecting a proposal from GOP leadership to raise the state and local tax (SALT) deduction cap to $30,000 in the party's bill full of President Trump's legislative priorities. The House Ways and Means Committee, which oversees the tax portions of the GOP megabill, had been...
title: SALT caucus rejects tax-writing panel’s offer of $30,000 deduction cap

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump is considering Fox News host and former judge Jeanine Pirro to serve as the top prosecutor in the District of Columbia, according to multiple reports. Pirro is not the only candidate being considered as a replacement for Ed Martin U.S. attorney in D.C. Trump indicated earlier Thursday he would likely withdraw Martin's nomination...
title: Trump mulls Fox News host Jeanine Pirro for top DC prosecutor post

author: Ellen Mitchell
description: Welcome to The Hill's Defense & NatSec newsletter {beacon} Defense &National Security Defense &National Security   The Big Story  Trump gets boost from Houthi ceasefire ahead of trip A ceasefire deal between Yemen’s Houthi rebels and the U.S., mediated by Oman, has secured a tentative end to attacks on American ships in the Red Sea....
title: Houthi ceasefire boosts Trump ahead of trip

author: Filip Timotija
description: Remote employees are the most likely to be engaged at work, but are less likely to be thriving at it, according to a new survey that was published on Thursday.  Gallup’s State of the Global Workplace report found that 31 percent of remote workers are engaged at work, 8 points higher than both those in...
title: Remote workers more engaged, less likely to be thriving: Gallup

author: Miranda Nazzaro
description: Leaders from Silicon Valley were met on Thursday with a new tone from Congress, where Republican lawmakers urged policymakers to prioritize tech innovation over regulations.   Over the course of more than three hours, four major technology leaders, including OpenAI CEO Sam Altman, pitched their ideas to senators on how to stay ahead of China in the...
title: Lawmakers push tech leaders on AI, energy in race with China

author: Jonathan Easley
description: {beacon} PRESIDENT TRUMP ON THURSDAY announced the first trade deal since enacting his “Liberation Day” tariffs that have roiled economies at home and abroad.   The details are still being finalized, but Trump and his team unveiled the broad contours of a deal with the United Kingdom that will open up billions of dollars in...
title: Trump gets a trade win; America gets a pope

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: The Washington State Supreme Court upheld the state's ban on high-capacity magazine guns in a Thursday ruling, overturning a lower court order that labeled it unconstitutional. The 7-2 decision affirmed the constitutionality of a three-year old state law that prevents the sale, manufacture and import of ammunition magazines that hold more than 10 rounds “This...
title: Top Washington state court upholds ban on high-capacity gun magazines

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: History was made on Thursday when Robert Francis Prevost was selected as the first American head of the Catholic Church, taking the name Pope Leo XIV.   The idea of an American pope has historically been considered a long shot because cardinals typically pick leaders from non-superpower nations.  Here are five takeaways from Thursday’s historic...
title: 5 takeaways from Robert Prevost's election as first American pope

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Health and Human Services (HHS) Secretary Robert F. Kenndy Jr. on Thursday issued an unrelenting defense of President Trump’s surgeon general nominee, Casey Means, who has faced an onslaught of criticism since the president tapped her for the influential government post late Wednesday. In a post on X on Thursday, Kennedy chastised her critics —...
title: Kennedy blasts critics of Trump's surgeon general nominee: 'Terrified of change'

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio says the Trump administration will review the visa statuses of all the protesters arrested at Columbia University on Wednesday night.  “We are reviewing the visa status of the trespassers and vandals who took over Columbia University’s library. Pro-Hamas thugs are no longer welcome in our great nation,” Rubio wrote on...
title: Rubio says administration will review visa statuses of arrested Columbia protesters

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Billionaire entrepreneur Bill Gates criticized Elon Musk for advising the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) to slash the budget of the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID), accusing the world’s richest man of “killing the world’s poorest children.” In an interview with the Financial Times, Gates suggested DOGE's cuts were too abrupt and left lifesaving...
title: Gates on Musk: 'World’s richest man killing the world’s poorest children'

author: Jared Gans
description: Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy called for a massive investment of billions of dollars in the country’s air traffic control system following a series of issues that have plagued it, most recently communication issues at the Newark, N.J., airport that stranded hundreds of flights.  Duffy said at a press conference on Thursday that he will ask...
title: Duffy calls for massive investment in new air traffic controller technology

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson (D) celebrated the Thursday selection of Pope Leo XIV, a Chicago native formerly known as Cardinal Robert Prevost, the first pontiff from the U.S. “Everything dope, including the Pope, comes from Chicago! Congratulations to the first American Pope Leo XIV! We hope to welcome you back home soon,” Johnson wrote in...
title: Chicago mayor: 'Everything dope, including the Pope, comes from Chicago!'

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Pope Leo XIV, formerly Cardinal Robert Prevost, frequently used social media to push back against Trump administration policies, and now emphasizes unity as the new Pope.
title: New Pope previously shared criticism of Trump administration on social media

author: Tara Suter
description: Democratic strategist James Carville went after Rep. Ilhan Omar (D-Minn.) on Wednesday, saying people like her are “more trouble than they’re worth.” Carville, speaking at an event in London, shot back at comments made by Omar seven years ago to Al Jazeera, in which she said the U.S. “should be more fearful of white men...
title: Carville: People like Omar 'more trouble than they're worth'

author: Karen Harned and F. Vincent Vernuccio, opinion contributors
description: President Trump's proposed reform aims to make top civil servants politically accountable, making it easier for federal workers to do their jobs and for the government to deliver on the agenda of the American people.
title: President Trump is making government accountable again

author: Cate Martel
description: Happy Thursday. We’re so close to Friday I can almost taste it! In today's issue: 🚨️ BREAKING New pope just dropped: White smoke is billowing from the Sistine Chapel’s chimney — and the bells are tolling. The 133 cardinals have elected a new pope. The crowd in St. Peter’s Square has been incredibly loud. Thousands...
title: Cardinals elect new pope

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump on Thursday touted how a trade agreement with the United Kingdom would benefit the British car industry, particularly luxury brands like Rolls-Royce and Bentley. As part of a trade deal announced in the Oval Office, the U.S. agreed to lower tariffs on British car imports from 25 percent to 10 percent. "We took...
title: Trump: US agreement will boost UK luxury carmakers

author: Tara Suter
description: Most California voters say Gov. Gavin Newsom (D) has focused more on a potential bid for the White House than his work in the governor’s mansion, according to a new poll.  In Wednesday's poll from the Institute of Governmental Studies (IGS) at the University of California, Berkeley, 54 percent of respondents said that amid Newsom’s...
title: Most California voters say Newsom focused more on White House than governor's mansion: Survey

author: Cheyanne M. Daniels
description: A freshman Democrat has introduced legislation to protect land-grant universities in an effort to block some of the White House’s steps to reduce federal funding for diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) programs.  Rep. Shomari Figures (D-Ala.) on Thursday introduced the Land-Grant Institution Parity Act, which would prohibit the Secretary of Agriculture or any other federal...
title: Alabama Democrat introduces legislation to protect land-grant schools

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Health and Human Services (HHS) Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s 2024 running mate, Nicole Shanahan, said late Wednesday that someone is “controlling” his decisions after President Trump named chronic disease entrepreneur Casey Means as his new surgeon general nominee. In a post on X, Shanahan called the announcement “strange,” adding that she was “promised” neither...
title: Shanahan: Someone 'controlling' RFK Jr. decisions

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: Former President Biden on Thursday denied accusations that his mental acuity took a slide toward the end of his presidency and called reporting that he was urged to drop out of the race over those concerns unfounded. "They are wrong, there is nothing to sustain that," Biden said during an appearance on ABC's "The View,"...
title: Biden says reports of mental decline are ‘wrong,’ defends not dropping out sooner

author: Julia Mueller
description: Former President Biden on Thursday said that President Trump is “vacant," in a jab at Trump's claims that some Biden-era pardons are void. Trump is “obsessed with the fact that you used an auto pen to sign the pardons you issued right before you left office,” said “The View” co-host Joy Behar. “Now, he's calling...
title: Biden quips that Trump is 'vacant' over voided pardon claims

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: The Department of Justice is charging a 20-year-old with hate crimes after he allegedly assaulted Jewish individuals with connections to Columbia University during protests both this year and in 2024 against the war between Israel and Hamas. Tarek Bazrouk was arrested and charged with three counts of hate crimes on Wednesday after the government says...
title: DOJ charges man with hate crimes over Columbia protests

author: Mychael Schnell
description: House Republicans on Thursday approved a bill to rename the Gulf of Mexico the “Gulf of America,” the first step in codifying one of the executive orders President Trump signed on Inauguration Day. The chamber cleared the legislation — titled the “Gulf of America Act” — in a 211-206 vote, sending it to the Senate for...
title: House GOP passes bill to rename 'Gulf of America'

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Right-wing provocateur Laura Loomer has attacked Dr. Casey Means, Trump's new nominee for U.S. surgeon general, for her background and beliefs, and has previously influenced White House staffing decisions.
title: Loomer targets new Trump surgeon general pick

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz (D) warned on Wednesday the country is “fully headed towards authoritarianism,” pointing to President Trump’s threats against political opponents and plans for a military parade that coincides with his birthday. In an interview on MSNBC’s “The Briefing with Jen Psaki,” the anchor and former Biden-era White House press secretary asked Walz...
title: Walz: Trump 'fully headed towards authoritarianism'

author: Casey Babb, opinion contributor
description: Ottawa has failed to articulate any meaningful strategy in response to major global events, while at the same time jeopardizing some of Canada’s most important diplomatic relations.
title: The US should be worried about Canada’s foreign policy

author: Tara Suter
description: Rep. Victoria Spartz (R-Ind.) said Wednesday that the U.S. will not “survive” if it’s not put on “sustainable fiscal paths.” “If we don’t put our country on sustainable fiscal paths, we are going to be not be able to survive as a country,” Spartz said on MSNBC’s “The Weeknight.” Spartz’s comments came on the same...
title: GOP rep says US won't 'survive' if it's not put on a 'sustainable fiscal paths'

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: A federal judge issued a stark warning to the Trump administration on Wednesday that the deportation of immigrants to Libya would violate a previous court order. “If there is any doubt—the Court sees none—the allegedly imminent removals, as reported by news agencies and as Plaintiffs seek to corroborate with class-member accounts and public information, would...
title: Judge warns Trump administration against swiftly deporting migrants to Libya

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump on Wednesday night teased a trade deal announcement, nearly a month after he implemented a 90-day pause on reciprocal tariffs and implemented a 145 percent tariff on China. “Big News Conference tomorrow morning at 10:00 A.M., The Oval Office, concerning a MAJOR TRADE DEAL WITH REPRESENTATIVES OF A BIG, AND HIGHLY RESPECTED, COUNTRY....
title: Trump teases ‘major trade deal’ with ‘big, highly respected country’

author: Tara Suter
description: Pro-Palestinian protestors clashed with security at Columbia University’s main library on Wednesday, according to a student newspaper. The Columbia Daily Spectator reported that protestors in Butler Library's Lawrence A. Wien Reading Room on Wednesday took part in an "Emergency Rally," but were stopped from getting out of the room by officers with the school's Department...
title: Pro-Palestinian protesters clash with security at Columbia University's main library

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: Chief Justice John Roberts said Wednesday he doesn’t think about retiring, but he once asked two longtime friends to intervene if his health is ever in decline.  “I've sat down with them and said, I want at the appropriate time — because you don't always notice that you're slipping — 'I want the two of you...
title: Roberts says he has no plans to retire: ‘I’m going out feet first’

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: President Trump said Wednesday he was not considering softening the 145 percent tariff on imports from China.  Reporters in the Oval Office asked if the president would consider reducing levies on the foreign nation, to which he succinctly responded, “No.” In early April, the Trump administration announced reciprocal tariff exemptions on electronics such as phones,...
title: Trump says he won’t soften China tariffs ahead of trade talks
